subject: The holidays are upon us!
header: It's a little slow, news-wise, and my world has gotten a little chaotic with holiday events, but check out two great articles on LPW, and other Perl news tidbits!
My next turn will be after the first of January, so for which ever of the @holidays is meaningful to you, have a lovely one!

entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

entries.title: Introducing JIRA::REST::Class
entries.author: packy_anderson
entries.text: Packy is working on wrapping JIRA::REST as an object, and seeks feedback!

entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: December 1st-7th
entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: Sawyer gives us highlights of the week on P5P.

entries.title: The MAIN thing
entries.author: ken_youens_clark
entries.text: Declaring a MAIN subroutine in Perl 6 can help with managing input arguments. Ken shows us how.

entries.title: My first ever talk at London Perl Workshop 2016
entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Mohammad tells us about the fun of giving his first conference presentation at LPW. Reminds me of some of my conference fun...

entries.title: The changing face of Perl: LPW 2016
entries.author: chloe_pearson
entries.text: Chloe talks about her first LPW, having just joined Eligo Technology recently

entries.title: meta::hack 2016
entries.author: joel_berger
entries.text: Joel's report on the long weekend of improvements to MetaCPAN

chapters.title: Perl Maven Pro
chapters.header: The Perl Maven Pro subscribers receive two new articles and screencasts every week. The last week these were the two screencasts:

entries.title: Saving Breakpoints in the Perl Debugger
entries.author: matthew_persico
entries.text: Matthew admits to reinventing wheels, and concisely demonstrates how to save a set of breakpoints with a .perldbinit file
